<https://github.com/vim/vim/commit/d2c946bacfedf4e506a4c6771758beddb87df3af|patch 8.2.0066: some corners of vim_snprintf() are not tested>
patch 8.2.0066: some corners of vim_snprintf() are not tested

Problem:    Some corners of vim_snprintf() are not tested.
Solution:   Add a test in C. (Dominique Pelle, closes #5422)

attachments.text: Problem: Some corners of vim_snprintf() are not tested. Solution: Add a test in C. (Dominique Pelle, closes #5422)

text:
<https://github.com/vim/vim/commit/ef140544f6703a7a4c0f6a15f610508ed6b09e89|patch 8.2.0067: ERROR_UNKNOWN clashes on some systems>
patch 8.2.0067: ERROR_UNKNOWN clashes on some systems

Problem:    ERROR_UNKNOWN clashes on some systems.
Solution:   Rename ERROR_ to FCERR_. (Ola Söder, closes #5415)

attachments.fallback: GitHub: patch 8.2.0067: ERROR_UNKNOWN clashes on some systems · vim/vim@ef14054
attachments.title: patch 8.2.0067: ERROR_UNKNOWN clashes on some systems · vim/vim@ef14054
attachments.text: Problem: ERROR_UNKNOWN clashes on some systems. Solution: Rename ERROR_ to FCERR_. (Ola Söder, closes #5415)

text:
<https://github.com/vim/vim/commit/556684ff71e044a642879d759373a7ebc5047fad|patch 8.2.0068: crash when using Python 3 with "utf32" encoding>
patch 8.2.0068: crash when using Python 3 with "utf32" encoding

Problem:    Crash when using Python 3 with "utf32" encoding. (Dominique Pelle)
Solution:   Use "utf-8" whenever enc_utf8 is set. (closes #5423)

attachments.fallback: GitHub: patch 8.2.0068: crash when using Python 3 with "utf32" encoding · vim/vim@556684f
attachments.title: patch 8.2.0068: crash when using Python 3 with "utf32" encoding · vim/vim@556684f
attachments.text: Problem: Crash when using Python 3 with "utf32" encoding. (Dominique Pelle) Solution: Use "utf-8" whenever enc_utf8 is set. (closes #5423)

text:
<https://github.com/vim/vim/commit/87396072c5c468f0c129e4ec7cd944ac897b7752|patch 8.2.0069: ETYPE_ is used for two different enums>
patch 8.2.0069: ETYPE_ is used for two different enums

Problem:    ETYPE_ is used for two different enums.
Solution:   Rename one to use EXPR_.

attachments.fallback: GitHub: patch 8.2.0069: ETYPE_ is used for two different enums · vim/vim@8739607
attachments.title: patch 8.2.0069: ETYPE_ is used for two different enums · vim/vim@8739607
attachments.text: Problem: ETYPE_ is used for two different enums. Solution: Rename one to use EXPR_.

text:
<https://github.com/vim/vim/commit/d518f952f0812778758b25139308bcf45df6988c|patch 8.2.0070: crash when using Python 3 with "debug" encoding>
patch 8.2.0070: crash when using Python 3 with "debug" encoding

Problem:    Crash when using Python 3 with "debug" encoding. (Dominique Pelle)
Solution:   Use "euc-jp" whenever enc_dbcs is set.

attachments.fallback: GitHub: patch 8.2.0070: crash when using Python 3 with "debug" encoding · vim/vim@d518f95
attachments.title: patch 8.2.0070: crash when using Python 3 with "debug" encoding · vim/vim@d518f95
attachments.text: Problem: Crash when using Python 3 with "debug" encoding. (Dominique Pelle) Solution: Use "euc-jp" whenever enc_dbcs is set.

text:
<https://github.com/vim/vim/commit/1832d12aea30f1533f3c461d9e1530d10f66b162|patch 8.2.0071: memory test often fails on Cirrus CI>
patch 8.2.0071: memory test often fails on Cirrus CI

Problem:    Memory test often fails on Cirrus CI.
Solution:   Allow for more tolerance in the upper limit.  Remove sleep.

attachments.fallback: GitHub: patch 8.2.0071: memory test often fails on Cirrus CI · vim/vim@1832d12
attachments.title: patch 8.2.0071: memory test often fails on Cirrus CI · vim/vim@1832d12
attachments.text: Problem: Memory test often fails on Cirrus CI. Solution: Allow for more tolerance in the upper limit. Remove sleep.

patch 8.2.0072: memory test still fails on Cirrus CI

Problem:    Memory test still fails on Cirrus CI.
Solution:   Allow for a tiny bit more tolerance in the upper limit.

patch 8.2.0073: initializing globals with COMMA is clumsy

Problem:    Initializing globals with COMMA is clumsy.
Solution:   Use INIT2(), INIT3(), etc.

attachments.text: Problem: Initializing globals with COMMA is clumsy. Solution: Use INIT2(), INIT3(), etc.
